I am feeling: A mix of excitement and nervousness
Describe your feelings: I am thrilled about the prospect of having another child, but also anxious about being a single mom again and the age gap between my boyfriend and me. It's a rollercoaster of emotions.
Describe any symptoms: I have been feeling more tired than usual, and my emotions seem to be all over the place. I also have some mild nausea in the mornings.
Highlights of the Week: Having a heart-to-heart conversation with my boyfriend about our future and the baby
Highlight of the week: Finally opening up to my boyfriend about my uncertainties and fears regarding the pregnancy, and feeling supported and understood by him.
My Goal: To take some time to reflect on my feelings and make a decision about whether to proceed with the pregnancy or not
Your goal: To carefully consider all my options and make the best decision for myself and my child, taking into account both my own well-being and that of the baby.
To Do List: Schedule a doctor's appointment for a checkup and counseling
Research and gather information about single parenting and co-parenting options
Talk to close friends or family members for emotional support and advice
Notes: This is a critical time for me to make an informed decision about the pregnancy. I need to prioritize my own mental and physical health, as well as the well-being of my child.
